send something ↔ on.translation[0].defin: to send someone’s letters or possessions to their new address from their old address
My flatmate said she’d send on all my post.
to send something that has been received to another place so that it can be dealt with
The data is then sent on to the Census Bureau.
send something ↔ on.translation[1].defin: to send something that has been received to another place so that it can be dealt with
Don’t let your paperwork pile up: send it on as soon as possible and work to a deadline.
